speaker: Inner Temple
line: The chamber is too quiet for stone. Your breath feels like a trespass. In the center, an altar waits—patient, impersonal, certain you will choose something.

speaker: Temple Voice
line: Choose: restore, rule, or end all. Every ending is a law you write into the world.

speaker: Temple Voice
line: Balance chosen. The world will keep its wounds—but it may learn to heal without permission.

speaker: Temple Voice
line: Rule chosen. The world will be orderly. And it will be afraid of you in the way fear pretends to be respect.

speaker: Temple Voice
line: Ash chosen. The machine will break. So will a great deal else. You’ve accepted the cost.

speaker: Inner Temple
line: The altar does not celebrate. It simply remembers what you decided.
